recipes.title: Caramel Apple Dip
recipes.description: A creamy caramel dip for apples and fruit made with milk powder and caramel topping.

instructions.text: Place milk powder, sugar, butter, salt, and boiling water in blender. Blend until consistency is even and no sugar remains on sides of blender container.
Add caramel topping and mix until well blended. Store in covered container.
Dip apple slices, marshmallows, pineapple, or bananas, etc. into caramel mixture and eat. Chopped peanuts may be added, or used as a second dip on the side.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Layered Bean Dip
recipes.description: A layered Tex-Mex dip with beans, taco seasoning, sour cream, and melted cheese.

instructions.text: Spread bean dip around bottom and sides of pie plate.
Mix together taco seasoning, sour cream, and mayonnaise; spread over beans.
Spread mashed avocado over that.
Sprinkle with chopped onion and then cheeses.
Sprinkle with tomato and olives.
Heat at 350°F until cheese melts, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Serve hot from oven with taco or corn chips.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for bean dip
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Nacho Dip
recipes.description: A hearty ground beef and Velveeta cheese dip served with nacho chips.

instructions.text: Brown hamburger and onion; drain fat.
Melt cheese; add soup and picante sauce.
Mix. Add meat mixture; mix well.
Serve with plain nacho chips.

notes: You may want to melt cheese in microwave, then transfer to a slow cooker to keep the cheese warm.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.25 cups) for cream of mushroom soup
Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Shrimp-Crabmeat Dip
recipes.description: An elegant seafood dip with cream cheese, shrimp, and crabmeat topped with Parmesan.

instructions.text: Add enough milk or cream to cream cheese for good spreading consistency.
Spread on large round plate.
Spread seafood sauce over cheese.
Top with shrimp and crabmeat.
Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on and garnish with fresh parsley.
Serve with crackers.

flags.issue: Shrimp, crabmeat, and Parmesan quantities not specified

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for tiny cleaned shrimp (standard quantity)
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Pineapple Cheese Ball
recipes.description: A sweet and savory cheese ball with crushed pineapple, rolled in chopped pecans.

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese until smooth.
Drain pineapple and add along with 1 cup pecans, green pepper, onions, and salt.
Shape into ball and roll in remaining nuts.
Wrap in foil and refrigerate until well chilled.
Serve with assorted crackers.

notes: Also shown: Soften cream cheese; gradually stir in crushed pineapple, 1 cup of pecans, green pepper, onion, and salt. Chill well. Form into ball and roll in 1 cup pecans. Garnish with cherries and parsley.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Shrimp and Cheddar Cheese on English Muffins
recipes.description: Easy appetizer bites with shrimp and cheese spread broiled on English muffins.

instructions.text: Soften cheese.
Mash up shrimp. Mix together; spread over muffins.
Cut into 6 pie shape pieces. (Can freeze at this point!)
Put under broiler (10 minutes if frozen) until golden brown.

notes: Can be frozen before broiling

assumptions: Used standard can size (0.5 cups) for small shrimp

recipes.title: Stuffed Pumpernickel Surprise
recipes.description: A creamy spinach dip served in a hollowed pumpernickel bread bowl.

ingredients.item: Knorr vegetable soup and recipe mix

instructions.text: Mix soup mix, sour cream, and mayonnaise until well blended.
Stir in spinach, water chestnuts, and onions.
Cover and chill 2 hours.
Cut out top of loaf in a circle.
Arrange on platter or tray. Pull bite-size pieces from center and inside loaf.
Place around loaf. Fill the center of loaf with chilled dip.
Enjoy.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cheese Ring
recipes.description: A molded cheese appetizer ring coated in pecans, served with crackers.

instructions.text: Combine first 5 ingredients and mix well.
Sprinkle about 1/4 cup pecans in an oiled 7-cup ring mold.
Press cheese mixture into mold. Chill until firm.
Unmold on platter. Pat remaining pecans onto cheese ring.
Garnish with parsley sprigs.
Serve on crackers with strawberry preserves on top if desired.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Holiday Cheese Ball
recipes.description: A festive cheese ball with cream cheese, pineapple, and pecans.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese and beat until smooth.
Gradually stir in crushed pineapple, 1 cup of pecans, green pepper, onion, and salt.
Chill well.
Form into ball and roll in remaining 1 cup pecans.
Garnish with cherries and parsley.
Serve with assorted crackers.

flags.issue: Recipe starts on this page but instructions were on previous page (not captured)

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Crabbies
recipes.description: Hot crabmeat and cheese appetizers on English muffins.

instructions.text: Mix first 4 ingredients and spread on split muffins.
Place on cookie sheets and broil until bubbly and golden on top.
Cool for a few minutes, then cut into 4 pieces each and serve while hot.

assumptions: Assumed 2 cup jar for Old English cheese
Used standard can size (0.75 cups) for chopped white crabmeat
Inferred 1 for Lawry's seasoning salt (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Pigs in a Blanket
recipes.description: Hot dogs wrapped in cheese-topped biscuits - a kid-friendly appetizer.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Flatten all biscuits, not touching sides on ungreased cookie sheets.
Cut slices of cheese into fourths. Lay one piece on each biscuit.
Cut hot dogs in halves. Lay the half into the biscuit and cheese.
Fold sides of biscuits together over hot dog. Hold in place with toothpick.
Cook for 10 minutes, or until golden brown.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for prepared biscuits
Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Spinach Dip
recipes.description: Classic spinach dip served in a pumpernickel bread bowl.

instructions.text: Thaw spinach and drain.
Mix all ingredients together.
Cut out center section of bread, then put dip mixture in bread.
Use bread chunks from center and also sliced vegetables with dip.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Knorr vegetable dry soup mix
assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Taco Dip
recipes.description: A layered taco dip with cream cheese, taco sauce, and fresh toppings.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese. Stir in 3/4 of the jar of taco sauce.
Spread on a platter.
Top with lettuce, onion, cheese, tomatoes, and black olives.
Serve with nacho chips.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Tex-Mex Dip
recipes.description: A layered avocado and bean dip with all the Tex-Mex fixings.

instructions.text: Peel, pit, and mash avocados in medium size bowl with lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Combine sour cream, mayonnaise, and seasoning in a bowl.

Spread bean dip in a large shallow serving platter and top with layers in the following order: Seasoned avocado mixture, sour cream/taco mix, sprinkle with chopped onions, tomatoes, olives, and cheese.
Serve chilled with tortilla chips.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for plain jalapeno flavored bean dip
Assumed 1 unit for black pitted ripe olives
Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Creamy Fruit Dip
recipes.description: A simple two-ingredient dip for fresh fruit.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese in microwave or let cream cheese get to room temperature.
Mix in marshmallow cream. Stir well until well blended.
Serve with fresh fruit.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Deviled Eggs - The Best
recipes.description: Classic deviled eggs with bacon and sweet pickles.

instructions.text: Cut eggs lengthwise and remove yolks. Mash yolks with a fork and add remaining ingredients.
Blend well. Refill whites using approximately 2 teaspoons of egg mixture per half.
Hint: Fix the day before to let the seasonings blend.

notes: Make the day before for best flavor

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Greg's Eggs
recipes.description: Spicy deviled eggs with jalapeno and bacon bits.

instructions.text: Hard-boil eggs and cut lengthwise; remove yolks.
Mix yolks with salad dressing, vinegar, sugar, and mustard until creamy.
Stir in shredded pickles and jalapeno pepper.
Add bacon bits and grated cheese; don't overstir. Stuff into egg white halves.

notes: Use real bacon bits - imitation ones get soggy
Adjust jalapeno to taste

recipes.title: Spinach Nuggets (Microwave)
recipes.description: Quick spinach appetizer balls cooked in the microwave.

instructions.text: Place spinach and onion in 1 1/2 quart casserole with water. Cook, covered, on HIGH 9 to 11 minutes, stirring once. Let stand 3 minutes. Drain well.
Add butter and stir till melted. Add stuffing mix and Parmesan cheese. Stir in eggs.
Shape into 1 inch balls. May be frozen. (Put in freezer for 10 minutes after putting on waxed paper lined baking sheet; thaw before cooking.)
To cook now, place 1/2 of balls in a 12 x 7 1/2 x 2 inch baking dish. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes, or until heated through. Repeat with remaining 1/2 of balls.

notes: May be frozen ahead and thawed before cooking

recipes.title: Greek Salsa
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe clipping from ATHENOS product packaging
recipes.description: A Mediterranean-style salsa dip with feta, olives, cucumber, and roasted red peppers. Served with pita chips.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until well blended.
Serve with pita chips.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Greek vinaigrette dressing

recipes.title: 7-Layer Taco Dip
recipes.source_note: Printed recipe card from Bob Evans
recipes.description: A hearty layered taco dip with sausage, beans, sour cream, salsa, and all the fixings. Perfect for game day.

instructions.text: In large skillet over medium heat, crumble and cook sausage until browned.
Stir in beans, chilies and taco seasoning mix.
Spread sausage mix into 7" x 11" serving dish.
Top with sour cream, then salsa.
Sprinkle olives, tomato and onion on top. Cover with cheese.
Serve immediately with chips. Refrigerate leftovers.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.75 cups) for refried beans
Used standard can size (0.5 cups) for chopped green chilies
Used standard can size (0.75 cups) for sliced black olives
Used standard jar size (2.0 cups) for salsa

recipes.title: Cheese Fondue
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 158
recipes.description: Also makes a great appetizer.

ingredients.item: coarsely shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese
dippers (cubed French or Italian bread or raw vegetables)

instructions.text: Bring shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese to room temperature. Toss flour with cheese; set aside. Rub inside of a fondue pot with garlic halves; discard garlic. Set pot aside.

In medium saucepan heat wine over medium heat till small bubbles rise to surface. Just before wine boils, reduce heat to low and stir in cheese mixture, a little at a time, stirring constantly and making sure cheese melts before adding more. Stir till mixture bubbles gently.
Stir in kirsch or sherry, nutmeg, and pepper. Transfer cheese mixture to the fondue pot; keep mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner. Serve with bread cubes or raw vegetables. Makes 5 servings.

notes: Onion-Cheese Fondue: Prepare as above, except stir 1/2 cup sliced green onion and 1/2 cup shredded carrot into the cheese mixture with the kirsch or sherry.
*Note: For a milder flavor, substitute 1/4 cup chicken broth or water for 1/4 cup of the wine.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Creamy Cheese Fondue
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: If you don't have a fondue pot, just serve this creamy fondue from a casserole dish.

ingredients.item: dry white wine or apple juice
package cream cheese with chives, softened
Dippers (breadsticks, cubed French bread, fruit wedges, or vegetables)

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan heat wine or juice just till bubbling. Add American cheese and mustard, stirring till smooth and bubbly. Stir in cream cheese; cook and stir over low heat till smooth.
Transfer mixture to a fondue pot. If desired, keep cheese mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner. Serve with dippers. Serves 3.

Microwave directions: In 1-quart casserole mix ½ cup wine or juice, American cheese, mustard, and cream cheese. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 4 to 5 minutes or till melted and bubbly, stir every minute. Serve as above.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese Fondue
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Also makes a great appetizer.

ingredients.item: coarsely shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese (12 ounces)
Dippers (cubed French or Italian bread or raw vegetables)

instructions.text: Bring shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese to room temperature. Toss flour with cheese; set aside. Rub inside of a fondue pot with garlic halves; discard garlic. Set pot aside.

In medium saucepan heat wine over medium heat till small bubbles rise to surface. Just before wine boils, reduce heat to low and stir in cheese mixture, a little at a time, stirring constantly and making sure cheese melts before adding more. Stir till mixture bubbles gently.
Stir in kirsch or sherry, nutmeg, and pepper. Transfer cheese mixture to the fondue pot; keep mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner. Serve with bread cubes or raw vegetables. Makes 5 servings.

notes: Onion-Cheese Fondue: Prepare as above, except stir 1/2 cup sliced green onion and 1/2 cup shredded carrot into the cheese mixture with the kirsch or sherry.
Note: For a milder flavor, substitute 1/4 cup chicken broth or water for 1/4 cup of the wine.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese Fondue
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic Swiss cheese fondue with crusty bread dippers

instructions.text: Bring cheese to room temperature. Toss together Gruyere, Swiss cheese, and flour.
In a saucepan heat wine and garlic over medium heat till small bubbles rise to surface.
Remove and discard garlic.
Gradually add small amounts of cheese mixture to wine, stirring constantly with a wire whisk after each addition till cheese is melted. Make sure cheese melts completely before adding more.
Stir till fondue bubbles gently.
Stir in kirsch and nutmeg.
Transfer fondue to a fondue pot; keep warm over fondue burner.
Serve with French bread cubes. (If fondue becomes too thick, stir in a little warmed wine.)

notes: Bring cheese to room temperature for best melting
If fondue becomes too thick, stir in a little warmed wine

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Onion-Cheese Fondue
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: French onion soup-inspired fondue with crusty bread

instructions.text: In a saucepan bring soup to boiling.
Gradually stir in Swiss cheese till melted.
Beat cream cheese till smooth. Gradually stir cream cheese into fondue mixture.
Heat and stir till smooth.
Transfer to fondue pot; keep warm over fondue burner.
Serve with French bread cubes. Stir in broth or water (by 1/4 cup) if the mixture gets too thick.

notes: Quick version using canned soup
Stir in broth or water by 1/4 cup if mixture gets too thick

recipes.title: Creamy Cheese Fondue
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: If you don't have a fondue pot, just serve this creamy mixture from a casserole dish

ingredients.item: dry white wine or apple juice

Stir till smooth and bubbly. Stir in cream cheese; cook and stir over low heat till smooth.
Transfer mixture to a fondue pot. If desired, keep cheese mixture bubbling gently over a fondue burner.

recipes.title: Pepperoni Bites
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Sink your teeth into these golden biscuits and savor the saucy pizza filling inside.

instructions.text: For filling, in a bowl combine mozzarella cheese, pepperoni, and pizza sauce. Set aside.
Separate biscuits. Flatten biscuits to 3-inch circles. Place about 1 rounded tablespoon filling in the center of each circle. Bring edges of dough together. Pinch to seal.
Place, seam side down, on greased baking sheets. Brush with milk. Sprinkle with Parmesan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for grated Parmesan cheese (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Crunchy Party Mix
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Odds are, you won't have any of this crispy snack left, but if you do, freeze it for up to four months.

ingredients.item: bite-size wheat or bran square cereal
bite-size rice or corn square cereal or bite-size shredded wheat biscuits

instructions.text: In a saucepan mix margarine, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and pepper sauce. Heat and stir till margarine melts.
In a large roasting pan mix pretzels, cereals, and nuts. Drizzle margarine mixture over cereal mixture; toss to coat.
Bake in a 300° oven for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes. Spread on foil to cool. Store in airtight container.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-cup measure combine the margarine or butter, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and hot pepper sauce. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 1½ to 2 minutes or till margarine melts, stirring once. In a 3-quart casserole combine half of the pretzels, cereals, and nuts. Drizzle half of the margarine mixture over cereal mixture, tossing to coat evenly. Cook, uncovered, on high for 5½ to 6 minutes or till hot, stirring three times. Spread on foil to cool (mix will become crisp on standing). Repeat with remaining ingredients.

Oriental-Style Party Mix: Prepare as above, except omit Worcestershire sauce and pretzels. Add 3 tablespoons soy sauce and 2 teaspoons five-spice powder to margarine mixture. Add one 5-ounce can chow mein noodles and 2 cups bite-size fish-shape crackers to cereal.

Italian-Style Party Mix: Prepare as above, except omit hot pepper sauce and increase garlic powder to 1 teaspoon. Add 2 teaspoons dried Italian seasoning to the margarine mixture. Immediately after baking, toss the warm cereal mixture with ½ cup grated Parmesan cheese.
Cajun-Style Party Mix: Prepare as above, except increase hot pepper sauce to 1 tablespoon and substitute 3 cups pecan halves for nuts.

missing_inputs: Not in database: small pretzels or pretzel sticks
assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Toasted Chili Nuts
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: walnut or pecan halves or pieces

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine margarine, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, onion salt, and red pepper. Heat and stir till margarine melts.
Spread nuts in a 9x9x2-inch baking pan. Toss with margarine mixture.
Bake in a 350° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till toasted, stirring occasionally. Spread on foil; cool. Store in an airtight container.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Nachos
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Build this spicy snack up to seven layers high.

ingredients.item: bulk pork sausage or ground beef

instructions.text: Cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown. Drain. Stir in beans.
Arrange half of the chips on each of two 12-inch ovenproof platters. Layer half of the meat-bean mixture, olives, chili peppers, and cheese on each platter.
Bake in a 350° oven for 5 to 7 minutes or till cheese melts. Serve with avocado dip, dairy sour cream, and salsa, if desired.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-quart casserole micro-cook meat, onion, and garlic, covered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 5 minutes or till no pink remains; stir once. Drain well. Stir in beans. Assemble as above. Cook on high for 2 to 3 minutes. Serve as above.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for bulk pork sausage or ground beef (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for sliced pitted ripe olives

recipes.title: Italian-Style Popcorn
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Great to munch in front of the TV.

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook and stir margarine, Italian seasoning, and garlic powder till margarine melts.
Toss with popcorn, coating evenly. Toss with cheese.

notes: Cajun-Style Popcorn: Prepare as above, except omit dried Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and Parmesan cheese. Combine 1 teaspoon paprika, ½ teaspoon garlic salt, and ¼ teaspoon each of ground white, red, and black pepper with the margarine.

missing_inputs: Not in database: dried Italian seasoning
assumptions: Inferred 2 for margarine or butter (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for grated Parmesan cheese (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Potato Skins
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Make the potato shells ahead. Then bake or fry them just before serving.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Prick potatoes with a fork. Bake in a 425° oven for 40 to 50 minutes or till tender. Cut into quarters. Scoop out the insides (reserve for another use), leaving ½-inch-thick shells.
Brush both sides of potato skins with margarine. Place, cut side up, on a large baking sheet.
Bake in a 425° oven for 10 to 15 minutes or till crisp. Sprinkle with cheese and, if desired, salt. Bake about 2 minutes more or till cheese melts. Serve with salsa and green onion.

notes: Fried Potato Skins: Prepare as above, except omit margarine and do not bake a second time. In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches melted shortening or cooking oil for deep-fat frying to 375°. Fry shells, a few at a time, for 1 to 2 minutes or till golden. Drain on paper towels. Place on a large baking sheet. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake in a 425° oven about 2 minutes.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for margarine or butter (standard quantity)
Inferred 2 for garlic or seasoned salt (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for sliced green onion (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Stuffed Mushrooms
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: These delectable morsels hold plenty of cheddar or blue cheese.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar or crumbled blue cheese

instructions.text: Wash and drain mushrooms. Remove stems. Reserve caps. Chop enough stems to make 1 cup.
In a medium saucepan cook stems, onion, and garlic in margarine or butter till tender.
Stir in bread crumbs and cheese. Spoon crumb mixture into mushroom caps.
Arrange mushrooms in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 425° oven 8 to 10 minutes or till heated through.

notes: Spinach-Stuffed Mushrooms: Prepare as above, except omit cheese. Cook 1 cup chopped fresh spinach with the stem mixture. Stir ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese and ½ teaspoon crushed dried marjoram into crumb mixture.

Sausage-Stuffed Mushrooms: Prepare as above, except omit margarine or butter and cheese. Reduce bread crumbs to 2 tablespoons. Cook ½ pound bulk Italian sausage with stem mixture till sausage is brown. Drain fat. Stir 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese and bread crumbs into sausage mixture.
Pepperoni-Stuffed Mushrooms: Prepare as above, except omit cheese. Stir ¼ cup chopped pepperoni and ½ teaspoon dried Italian seasoning into the crumb mixture.

Ham-Stuffed Mushrooms: Prepare as above, except substitute crushed corn bread stuffing mix for bread crumbs and omit cheese. Stir ¼ cup finely chopped fully cooked ham and 2 tablespoons chopped pecans into stuffing mixture.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for sliced green onion (standard quantity)
Inferred 2 for margarine or butter (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for fine dry bread crumbs
Inferred 1.0 for shredded cheddar or crumbled blue cheese (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Creamy Dill Dip
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: For colorful dippers, serve carrot sticks, broccoli or cauliflower florets, and mushrooms.

ingredients.item: vegetable dippers, assorted crackers, or chips

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl beat cream cheese, sour cream, onion, dillweed, and seasoned salt with an electric mixer till fluffy.
Chill up to 24 hours. If dip thickens after chilling, stir in 1 or 2 tablespoons milk. Serve with vegetable dippers, crackers, or chips.

notes: Creamy Onion Dip: Prepare as above, except omit onion, dillweed, and seasoned salt. Stir 2 tablespoons (½ of an envelope) regular onion soup mix into beaten cream cheese mixture.
Creamy Blue Cheese Dip: Prepare as above, except omit dillweed and seasoned salt. Stir ½ cup crumbled blue cheese and ½ cup finely chopped walnuts into the beaten cream cheese mixture.
Creamy Seafood Dip: Prepare as above, except stir one 6½-ounce can minced clams, drained, or crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed, into beaten cheese mixture.

Creamy Tarragon Dip: Prepare as above, except omit dillweed and seasoned salt. Stir ½ cup finely chopped watercress or parsley, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon anchovy paste, and ½ teaspoon crushed dried tarragon into the beaten cream cheese mixture.

assumptions: Inferred 1 for seasoned salt or salt (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for vegetable dippers, assorted crackers, or chips

recipes.title: Chili con Queso
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion in margarine till tender. Stir in tomatoes and peppers. Simmer, uncovered, 10 minutes.
Toss cheeses with cornstarch. Gradually add to saucepan, stirring till melted. Stir in hot sauce. Heat through. Serve with chips.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1½-quart casserole micro-cook onion and margarine, covered, on 100% power (high) for 1½ to 2½ minutes. Add tomatoes and peppers. Cook, covered, on high 2 to 4 minutes or till tender. Toss cheeses with cornstarch. Gradually add to casserole, stirring till melted. Stir in hot sauce. Cook, uncovered, on high 2 minutes or till heated; stir twice. Serve with chips.

recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: To keep the fruit looking just-picked, brush it with lemon juice.

ingredients.item: dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

instructions.text: Stir together sour cream, preserves (cut up large pieces of fruit), and cinnamon.
Chill up to 24 hours. Serve with fruit.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for apricot or peach preserves
Assumed 1 unit for apple, pear, or peach slices

recipes.title: Hot Cheese Dip
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: French bread cubes or tortilla chips

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion, garlic, and tarragon in margarine. Stir in cornstarch.
Add beer all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Gradually add cheeses, stirring till melted. Serve with bread or chips.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped green onion (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for beer or milk (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for French bread cubes or tortilla chips

recipes.title: Guacamole
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fiery chili peppers and creamy, cool avocados pair up in this Mexican favorite.

ingredients.prep_note: drained, or several dashes bottled hot pepper sauce

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine avocados, onion, chili peppers or hot pepper sauce, cilantro, lemon juice, garlic, and salt.
Cover and blend or process till mixture is smooth, scraping sides as necessary. Stir in tomato, if desired.
Transfer to a serving bowl. Cover and chill up to 24 hours. Serve with chips.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for diced green chili peppers (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Cheese and Pesto Spread
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese and Brie cheese.

For pesto, in a blender container combine basil, parsley, Parmesan cheese, nuts, garlic, and 2 tablespoons oil. Cover; blend with on-off turns till a paste forms. Gradually add remaining oil, blending on low speed till smooth.
Beat cream cheese and Brie together till nearly smooth. Beat whipping cream till soft peaks form. Fold whipped cream into cheese mixture.
Line a 3½- or 4-cup mold with plastic wrap. Spread one-fourth of cheese mixture into mold. Top with one-third of pesto. Repeat layers twice. Top with cheese mixture. Chill 6 to 24 hours.
To serve, unmold on plate. Remove plastic wrap. Garnish with fresh basil, if desired. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for firmly packed parsley sprigs
Inferred 1.0 for grated Parmesan cheese (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for pine nuts, walnuts, or almonds
Inferred 2 for olive oil or cooking oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Cheddar Cheese Ball
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Skip last-minute hassle by making this appetizer ahead and freezing it.

ingredients.item: snipped parsley or finely chopped walnuts or pecans

instructions.text: Bring cheddar cheese, cream cheese, and margarine to room temperature. Add milk, onion, pimiento, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce.
Beat till combined. Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, shape mixture into a ball. Roll in parsley or nuts. Let stand 15 minutes. Garnish with pimiento strips, if desired. Serve with crackers.

notes: Blue Cheese Ball: Prepare as above, except omit diced pimiento and parsley, walnuts or pecans. Add ¼ cup crumbled blue cheese to cheese mixture. Roll in chopped toasted almonds.
Deviled-Ham-and-Cheese Ball: Prepare as above, except substitute Swiss cheese for cheddar cheese and omit Worcestershire sauce. Add one 3-ounce can deviled ham to cheese mixture.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for snipped parsley or finely chopped walnuts or pecans

recipes.title: Feta Cheese Ball
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: snipped parsley or finely chopped toasted almonds

instructions.text: Bring cheeses and margarine to room temperature. Beat till combined.
Stir in olives and onion. Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, shape into a ball. Roll in parsley or almonds. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for margarine or butter (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for chopped ripe olives
Assumed 1 unit for snipped parsley or finely chopped toasted almonds

recipes.title: Eight-Layer Spread
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: For variety, add a ninth layer of alfalfa sprouts.

ingredients.item: shredded Monterey Jack or cheddar cheese
sliced or chopped pitted ripe olives

instructions.text: Stir together beans and picante or taco sauce.

Arrange lettuce on a 12-inch platter, leaving a 2-inch open rim at edge of platter. Spread bean mixture over lettuce, making a layer about ¼ inch thick. Then layer sour cream and avocado dip. Top with cheese, onion, and olives.
Cover and chill up to 24 hours. Before serving, arrange tomatoes on top. Arrange the chips on a platter around spread.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for picante or taco sauce
Inferred 1.0 for sliced green onion (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for tortilla chips or crackers

recipes.title: Cream-Cheese-Stuffed Slices
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: finely chopped green onion or snipped chives

instructions.text: Trim ends from rolls. Carefully scoop out centers, leaving ½-inch-thick shells. Reserve centers for another use. Set bread shells aside.
In a bowl combine cream cheese, sour cream, onion or chives, pimiento, parsley, and seasoned salt. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed till smooth.
Stuff bread shells with cheese mixture, pressing firmly to prevent air pockets. Wrap in foil or plastic wrap. Chill 4 to 24 hours.
To serve, cut rolls into ½-inch slices.

notes: Bacon-Stuffed Slices: Prepare as above, except omit pimiento and seasoned salt. Stir 4 slices crumbled, cooked bacon into the cream cheese mixture.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for dairy sour cream (standard quantity)
Inferred 1 for seasoned salt or salt (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Shrimp-Cucumber Spread
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.prep_note: rinsed, drained, and chopped; or 1 cup cooked shrimp, peeled, deveined, and chopped

ingredients.item: melba toast rounds or assorted crackers or bread

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl stir together cream cheese, mayonnaise or salad dressing, catsup, mustard, and garlic powder.
Stir in shrimp, cucumber, and onion. Spread mixture over melba toast or crackers.

notes: Cut white, wheat, or rye bread into decorative shapes with small cookie or hors d'oeuvres cutters, if desired.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for finely chopped seeded cucumber
Assumed 1 unit for melba toast rounds or assorted crackers or bread

recipes.title: Nutty Cheese Spread
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Stuff some celery sticks with this creamy spread and add them to a relish tray.

ingredients.item: celery sticks, apple slices, assorted crackers, or melba toast rounds

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl bring cream cheese and Swiss or cheddar cheese to room temperature.
Add walnuts, milk, parsley, and onion powder. Stir till combined. Cover and chill up to 24 hours.
To serve, spread on celery sticks, apple slices, crackers, or melba toast rounds.

notes: Brush apple slices with lemon juice or ascorbic-acid color keeper, if desired.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for shredded Swiss or cheddar cheese (standard quantity)
Inferred 0.5 for celery sticks, apple slices, assorted crackers, or melba toast rounds (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Curried Chicken Spread
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Curry powder and sour cream turn ordinary chicken salad into a tasty topping for party bread.

ingredients.item: slices party rye or pumpernickel bread

instructions.text: In a medium mixing bowl combine mayonnaise or salad dressing, sour cream, green onion, nuts, curry powder, and salt.
Stir in chicken. Spread chicken mixture over bread (or chill up to 24 hours before spreading).
Sprinkle with parsley, if desired.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped cooked chicken (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Avocado Pita Wedges
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Avocado and mozzarella cheese make a great team in these minisandwiches.

ingredients.item: small whole wheat or white pita bread rounds

instructions.text: Cut each pita bread round into quarters. Spread the inside of each with mayonnaise.
Peel and seed avocado. Cut half of the avocado into 6 slices. (Reserve remaining avocado for another use.) Cut each slice in half crosswise.
Toss together cheese, tomato, and carrot. Spoon into each pita quarter. Place an avocado piece in each. Top with alfalfa sprouts. Secure with toothpicks, if necessary.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for mayonnaise or salad dressing
Inferred 1.0 for shredded mozzarella cheese (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Cocktail Meatballs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: Tangy Cranberry Sauce, Dill Sauce, or Polynesian Sauce

instructions.text: In a bowl combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, parsley, mustard, salt, and pepper. Add beef. Mix well.
Shape into 1-inch meatballs. Place in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till done. Drain.
Meanwhile, prepare Tangy Cranberry Sauce, Dill Sauce, or Polynesian Sauce. Add meatballs to sauce and heat through.

notes: Tangy Cranberry Sauce: In a saucepan combine one 8-ounce can jellied cranberry sauce, 2 tablespoons steak sauce, and 1 tablespoon brown sugar. Heat, stirring occasionally.

Dill Sauce: In a saucepan melt 2 tablespoons margarine or butter. Stir in 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon instant beef bouillon granules, dash ground nutmeg, and dash pepper. Add ¾ cup water. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in ¾ cup light cream and 1 teaspoon dried dillweed.

Polynesian Sauce: Drain one 15¼-ounce can pineapple chunks, reserving juice. Add water to juice to make 1 cup. In a saucepan combine juice mixture, 2 tablespoons catsup, 2 tablespoons vinegar, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, 1 tablespoon brown sugar, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, ½ teaspoon instant beef bouillon granules, and dash ground red pepper. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add pineapple and 1 green or sweet red pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for fine dry bread crumbs
Assumed 1 unit for Tangy Cranberry Sauce, Dill Sauce, or Polynesian Sauce

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Franks
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.prep_note: bias-sliced into 1-inch pieces, or 1 pound cocktail wieners

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine syrup, juice, vinegar, cornstarch, Worcestershire sauce, and mustard.
Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in frankfurters and onions. Cook, stirring occasionally, 8 minutes or till onions are tender. Serves 16.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-quart casserole micro-cook first six ingredients, uncovered, on 100% power (high) 3 to 5 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute. Stir in frankfurters and onions. Cook on high for 6 to 8 minutes or till onions are tender; stir once.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for orange or pineapple juice

recipes.title: Mustard-Glazed Ribs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: For easier eating, ask your butcher to saw the ribs in half across the bones.

ingredients.item: meaty pork loin back ribs or spareribs

instructions.text: Cut ribs into single-rib portions. In a bowl combine 2 tablespoons brown sugar, paprika, turmeric, and ½ teaspoon salt. Rub mixture over ribs.
Roast ribs, meaty side up, in a shallow roasting pan in a 350° oven for 1 hour.
For sauce, in a saucepan combine the remaining brown sugar, onion, vinegar, mustard, celery seed, and garlic powder. Bring to boiling, stirring till sugar dissolves.
Drain fat from pan. Brush ribs with sauce. Roast 30 to 45 minutes more or till done, brushing frequently with sauce.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for packed brown sugar (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Barbecue-Style Chicken Wings
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Provide lots of napkins with these saucy wings.

instructions.text: Rinse chicken; pat dry. Cut off and discard wing tips. Cut each wing at joint to make 2 sections. Place the wing pieces in a single layer in a 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 375° oven for 20 minutes. Drain fat from baking pan.
For sauce, combine remaining ingredients. Brush wings with sauce. Bake 10 minutes. Turn wings over; brush again with sauce. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes or till chicken is tender.

notes: Microwave directions: Prepare the chicken wings as above. Place wing pieces in a single layer in a 12x7½x2-inch baking dish. Cover with waxed paper. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 5 minutes. Drain. For sauce, combine remaining ingredients. Brush wings with sauce. Turn wings over and rearrange. Brush with sauce. Cook, covered, on high for 3 to 5 minutes more or till chicken is no longer pink.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Rumaki
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: If you like chicken livers, you'll love these.

instructions.text: Combine wine, soy sauce, oil, sugar, garlic powder, ginger, and ¼ cup water. Stir in livers and water chestnuts. Cover; chill 4 to 24 hours.
Cook bacon slightly. Drain. Drain livers and water chestnuts.
Wrap a bacon piece around a liver half and a water chestnut slice. Secure with a wooden toothpick.
Broil 4 inches from heat for 6 to 8 minutes or till livers are no longer pink; turn once. Serve warm.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for sliced water chestnuts

recipes.title: Cheese Twists
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: These pastry snacks go great alone or with salads.

ingredients.item: finely shredded cheddar or American cheese
toasted sesame seed or poppy seed

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine flour, garlic powder, salt, and, if desired, red pepper. Cut in cheese and margarine or butter till pieces are the size of small peas. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the water over part of the mixture. Gently toss with a fork. Push to side of bowl. Repeat till all of flour mixture is moistened. Shape dough into a ball.

On a lightly floured surface, flatten dough with hands. Roll out dough from center to edges, forming a 10-inch square. Brush with egg. Sprinkle with sesame seed or poppy seed. Cut dough into 5x½-inch strips. Twist each strip.
Place on lightly greased baking sheets. Bake in a 400° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till golden brown. Serve warm or cool.

notes: Herbed Parmesan Twists: Prepare as above, except do not use red pepper, add ¼ teaspoon crushed dried oregano to the flour mixture, and substitute 3 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese for the sesame or poppy seed.
Swiss-Caraway Twists: Prepare as above, except substitute Swiss cheese for the cheddar or American cheese and caraway seed for the sesame seed or poppy seed.

missing_inputs: Not in database: toasted sesame seed or poppy seed
assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for ground red pepper (standard quantity)
Inferred 2 for margarine or butter (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Pastry-Wrapped Olives
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine 1 stick piecrust mix, ½ cup shredded cheddar cheese, and a dash ground red pepper. Prepare piecrust dough according to package directions.
Pat 30 pitted ripe or pimiento-stuffed olives dry with paper towels. Shape about 1 teaspoon of the dough around each olive. Place on a baking sheet.
Bake in a 375° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for shredded cheddar cheese (standard quantity)
Inferred 0.25 for ground red pepper (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Egg Rolls
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: These crisp, golden egg rolls make a delicious start to any meal.

ingredients.item: Crab Filling, Pork and Shrimp Filling, Ham-Orange Filling, or Vegetable Filling

instructions.text: For each egg roll, place one egg roll skin on a flat surface with one corner toward you. Spoon about ¼ cup of the desired filling just below the center of egg roll skin.
Fold the corner nearest you over the filling, tucking the corner under the filling. Fold side corners over top, like an envelope. Roll up toward the remaining corner.
Moisten the point with water and press firmly to seal.
In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or cooking oil to 365°. Fry the egg rolls, a few at a time, for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying the remainder. Serve warm egg rolls with Sweet-Sour Sauce or Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce, or both.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Crab Filling, Pork and Shrimp Filling, Ham-Orange Filling, or Vegetable Filling (standard quantity)
Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce

recipes.title: Wontons
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Every bit as tasty as egg rolls, wontons are smaller and more manageable at appetizer parties. One or two bites and it's time to reach for another.

ingredients.item: Crab Filling, Pork and Shrimp Filling, Ham-Orange Filling, or Vegetable Filling

instructions.text: For each wonton, place one wonton skin on a flat surface with one corner toward you. Spoon a rounded teaspoon of desired filling just below the center of wonton skin.

Fold the corner closest to you over the filling and tuck it under the filling. Roll up, leaving 1 inch unrolled at the top. Moisten the right corner with water. Grasp right and left corners and bring them over the filling, lapping the right corner over the left corner. Press firmly to seal.
In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or oil to 365°. Fry the wontons, a few at a time, for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying the remainder. Serve warm with Sweet-Sour Sauce or Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce, or both.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Crab Filling, Pork and Shrimp Filling, Ham-Orange Filling, or Vegetable Filling (standard quantity)
Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for Oriental-Style Mustard Sauce

recipes.title: Crab Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Use this or any of the following three fillings for either Egg Rolls or Wontons.
recipes.servings_yield: 2 cups (enough for 8 egg rolls or 40 wontons)

instructions.text: In a skillet cook 1 cup chopped Chinese cabbage or cabbage, ½ cup finely chopped pea pods, ¼ cup chopped water chestnuts, 2 tablespoons finely chopped onion, and 1 clove garlic, minced, in 1 tablespoon cooking oil for 2 to 3 minutes or till crisp-tender. Remove from heat.

In a mixing bowl combine one 6-ounce can crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed; 2 tablespoons soy sauce; 2 tablespoons dry sherry; ⅛ teaspoon pepper; and the cooked vegetable mixture. Toss to mix.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for finely chopped pea pods
Assumed 1 unit for chopped water chestnuts

recipes.title: Pork and Shrimp Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: 2 cups (enough for 8 egg rolls or 40 wontons)

instructions.text: Thaw one 6-ounce package frozen, peeled, cooked shrimp. Cut up shrimp.

In a mixing bowl combine shrimp, ½ cup finely chopped cooked pork, ½ cup finely chopped bean sprouts, ½ cup finely chopped fresh mushrooms, ¼ cup sliced green onion, 2 tablespoons soy sauce, and 1 teaspoon grated gingerroot. Mix well.

missing_inputs: Not in database: finely chopped bean sprouts
assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped cooked pork (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped fresh mushrooms (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for sliced green onion (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Ham-Orange Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: 2 cups (enough for 8 egg rolls or 40 wontons)

instructions.text: In a bowl combine ¾ cup finely chopped fully cooked ham, ½ cup chopped bamboo shoots, ½ cup finely chopped onion, ½ cup finely chopped broccoli, ½ teaspoon finely shredded orange peel, 2 tablespoons orange juice, and ⅛ teaspoon ground red pepper. Mix well.

assumptions: Inferred 0.5 for finely chopped fully cooked ham (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for chopped bamboo shoots
Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for finely chopped broccoli
Assumed 1 unit for finely shredded orange peel

recipes.title: Vegetable Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: 2 cups (enough for 8 egg rolls or 40 wontons)

instructions.text: In a steamer basket over boiling water place 1 cup chopped fresh spinach, 1 cup shredded carrot, 1 cup chopped fresh mushrooms, ½ cup shredded zucchini, and ¼ cup finely chopped onion. Cover; steam for 4 minutes. Drain well.
Transfer to a mixing bowl. Stir in 2 tablespoons soy sauce, ½ teaspoon dry mustard, ¼ teaspoon pepper, and ⅛ teaspoon garlic powder.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Spinach Phyllo Triangles
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: For filling, cook spinach, onion, and garlic according to spinach package directions. Drain well in colander. Press the back of a spoon against mixture to force out excess moisture. Combine spinach mixture, feta cheese, and oregano.

Lightly brush 1 sheet of phyllo with some of the melted margarine or butter. Place another phyllo sheet on top; brush with some margarine. Repeat with a third sheet of phyllo and margarine. (Cover the remaining phyllo with a damp cloth to prevent drying.) Cut the stack of phyllo lengthwise into 6 strips.

For each triangle, spoon about 1 tablespoon of the filling about 1 inch from one end of each strip. Fold the end over the filling at a 45-degree angle. Continue folding to form a triangle that encloses filling. Repeat with remaining phyllo, margarine or butter, and filling.
Place triangles on a baking sheet. Brush with margarine. Bake in a 375° oven for 18 to 20 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

missing_inputs: Not in database: sheets phyllo dough
assumptions: Inferred 2 for margarine or butter (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Oysters Rockefeller
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook spinach and onion in a small amount of boiling water for 2 to 3 minutes or till tender. Drain; press out excess moisture.
Thoroughly wash oysters. Open shells with an oyster knife or other blunt-tipped knife. Remove oysters and dry. Discard flat top shells; wash deep bottom shells. Place each oyster in a shell.
Combine spinach mixture, 2 tablespoons of margarine, parsley, garlic, hot sauce, and dash pepper. Spoon 1 teaspoon atop each oyster.
Toss together crumbs and remaining margarine. Sprinkle over spinach-topped oysters.
Line a shallow baking pan with rock salt to about ½-inch depth. (Or, use crumpled foil to keep shells from tipping.) Arrange oysters atop.
Bake in a 425° oven 10 to 12 minutes or till edges of oysters begin to curl.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for finely chopped onion (standard quantity)
Inferred 0.25 for bottled hot pepper sauce (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for fine dry seasoned bread crumbs

recipes.title: Salmon Mousse
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Drain salmon, reserving liquid. Add water to liquid to make ½ cup. In saucepan sprinkle gelatin over reserved liquid. Let stand 5 minutes. Heat and stir till gelatin dissolves. Remove from heat.
Mix mayonnaise, chili sauce, and lemon juice. Stir into gelatin. Chill till partially set (consistency of unbeaten egg whites). Fold in salmon, eggs, celery, onion, chives, and ⅛ teaspoon pepper.
Beat cream till soft peaks form. Fold into gelatin mixture. Pour into a 3½- or 4-cup mold. Chill 4 to 24 hours.
Unmold on lettuce-lined serving platter. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for mayonnaise or salad dressing
Inferred 0.5 for finely chopped celery (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Shrimp Cocktail
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Arrange shrimp in six lettuce-lined cocktail cups or glasses.
Spoon 1 tablespoon of the Cocktail Sauce over each. Serve with lemon.

notes: Fruit Shrimp Cocktail: Prepare as above, except toss 1 peeled and sectioned orange, 1 peeled and sectioned grapefruit, and 1 seeded, peeled, and sliced avocado with the shrimp.
Crab Cocktail: Prepare as above, except substitute two 6-ounce packages frozen crabmeat, thawed, and 2 cups finely chopped celery for the shrimp.

recipes.title: Codfish Balls
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Soak cod in water to cover for 4 to 24 hours; change water often. Drain; cut into small pieces.
Cook cod, potatoes, and onion in boiling water about 10 minutes or till tender; drain. Beat mixture till combined.
Beat in egg, cheese, parsley, margarine, and ¼ teaspoon pepper.

In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or oil to 375°. Drop cod mixture by heaping tablespoons, a few at a time, into hot fat. Fry about 2 minutes or till golden. Drain on paper towels. Serve with tartar or cocktail sauce, if desired.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Batter-Fried Vegetables
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Bottled buttermilk salad dressing or sweet-and-sour sauce also make flavorful dipping sauces.

ingredients.item: ice water, cold milk, or cold beer

vegetables (fresh whole mushrooms; cauliflower or broccoli flowerets; green pepper strips; onion rings; green onions; fresh green beans; fresh asparagus, cut into 2-inch lengths; sweet potato, peeled and cut into ¼-inch-thick slices; eggplant, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes)

instructions.text: For batter, in a medium mixing bowl stir together egg and ice water, milk, or beer. Add flour all at once. Beat with a rotary beater or wire whisk till mixture is smooth. Set aside.
Rinse vegetables under cold water; drain. Pat dry with paper towels. Set aside.

In a heavy saucepan or deep-fat fryer, heat 2 inches of melted shortening or cooking oil to 375°. Dip vegetables, a few at a time, into the batter, swirling to coat. Fry for 2 to 3 minutes or till light golden brown. Drain vegetables on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven. Repeat with remaining vegetables. Serve with individual bowls of Dipping Sauce.

notes: Dipping Sauce: In a small saucepan stir together 1 cup water, ¼ cup dry sherry, ¼ cup soy sauce, and 1 teaspoon grated gingerroot. Bring just to boiling. Remove from heat; keep warm. Makes 1⅓ cups.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Fried Cheese
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Seasoned crumbs keep the melted cheese inside.

instructions.text: Cut the cheese into 2½x½x½-inch sticks. Combine crumbs and fines herbes.

Dip cheese sticks into eggs, then roll in crumb mixture, coating evenly. Dip cheese into egg and crumbs again. (Be sure cheese is completely coated with crumbs.) Chill 2 to 4 hours to set the coating.
In a heavy saucepan or a deep-fat fryer heat 2 inches of melted shortening or cooking oil to 375°. Fry the cheese sticks, a few at a time, for 30 to 45 seconds or till golden. Drain on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 300° oven while frying the remainder. Serve warm with taco sauce, if desired.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for shortening or cooking oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Stuffed Cherry Tomatoes
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The refreshing herb-cheese filling brings out the best in these tiny tomatoes.

ingredients.item: snipped fresh or frozen chives, or 1 teaspoon dried chives

instructions.text: Slice a thin layer off top of each tomato. Using a small spoon, carefully scoop out and discard pulp. Invert tomatoes; drain on paper towels.
For filling, in a small bowl combine cream cheese, chives, milk, basil, pepper, and garlic powder. Beat till smooth.
Spoon or pipe the filling into tomatoes. Serve immediately or chill up to 8 hours.

recipes.title: Chicken Liver Pâté
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: ground nutmeg or ⅛ teaspoon ground allspice

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon from skillet, reserving 2 tablespoons of drippings. Drain and crumble bacon; set aside.
Add chicken livers, onion, and garlic to reserved drippings. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, about 5 minutes or till livers are no longer pink. Cool slightly.

In a blender container or food processor bowl place 2 tablespoons milk, salt, nutmeg or allspice, pepper, chicken liver mixture, and bacon. Cover and blend or process till well combined. (Add 1 tablespoon milk if mixture appears stiff.)
Line a 1½-cup mold or small bowl with plastic wrap. Spoon mixture into mold. Cover; chill 3 to 24 hours.
To serve, unmold and remove wrap. Serve with crackers.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for ground nutmeg or ⅛ teaspoon ground allspice

recipes.title: Marinated Cheese and Olives
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The cheese takes on a trio of Mediterranean flavors: lemon, garlic, and fennel.

ingredients.item: cheddar, Colby, Edam, Gouda, or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Cut cheese and pepperoni or salami into ½-inch pieces.
In a bowl combine oil, lemon juice, garlic, fennel seed, and pepper.
Stir in cheese, pepperoni or salami, and olives. Cover and chill up to 3 days, stirring occasionally.
Let stand 30 minutes at room temperature before serving. Serve with toothpicks.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for olive oil or salad oil (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Lemon and Herb Mushrooms
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Oregano and thyme add zest to these tangy mouthfuls.

instructions.text: Halve any large mushrooms. In a medium saucepan cook mushrooms in boiling water 1 minute. Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside.
For marinade, in a small saucepan combine lemon juice, salad oil, sugar, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and thyme. Cook till boiling. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
In a medium mixing bowl combine drained mushrooms, hot marinade, and sliced onion. Cover and chill 4 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1-quart casserole micro-cook mushrooms and 2 tablespoons water, covered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 4 minutes or till tender. Drain and set aside. In the same casserole combine lemon juice, salad oil, sugar, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and thyme. Cook, uncovered, on high for 1 to 2 minutes or till boiling. Assemble as above.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for small fresh whole mushrooms (standard quantity)
Inferred 0.25 for coarse ground black pepper (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Melon and Prosciutto
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Spicy prosciutto, a thinly sliced Italian ham, meshes perfectly with cool crisp melon.

ingredients.item: large cantaloupe or honeydew melon, or half of each melon
very thinly sliced prosciutto or fully cooked ham

instructions.text: Cut cantaloupe or honeydew melon in half and remove seeds. Use a melon baller to scoop out pulp, or cut pulp into bite-size cubes.
Cut prosciutto or ham into 1-inch-wide strips.
Wrap one strip of prosciutto or ham around each melon ball. Fasten with a toothpick.
In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine all the ingredients except the parsley and heat to boiling. Reduce the heat; simmer, covered, for 5 minutes.
Strain the mixture into an 8-inch square pan; stir in the parsley. Cover and freeze until solid.

When ready to serve, let the mixture stand at room temperature 15 to 20 minutes, loosening it up with a spoon. Beat the mixture with an electric mixer until smooth, but not melted. Spoon it into sherbet glasses or appetizer dishes. Garnish each serving with a sprig of parsley.
Blend the cheeses together. Add all the other ingredients and mix well. Divide the mixture into 2 or 3 pieces and form each into a roll or form the mixture into 1 large ball.
Coat it with chili powder, crushed peanuts, or chopped nuts. Wrap in waxed paper and refrigerate; slice and serve on crackers.
Mix all the ingredients and serve with tostados or chips.

recipes.title: Chicken Livered Cheese 'n Chile Puffs

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Pat the chicken livers dry; then fry them in heated oil until brown and well cooked. Cool them and chop finely.

Heat the butter and saute the onion and garlic until limp. Add the tomato, chicken bouillon, sugar, salt, and pepper. Cook until very soft and mushy. Remove from the heat and cool. Add the livers and stir well.
Blend the softened cream cheese with the mayonnaise. Add the chiles and horseradish and mix thoroughly. Stir in the parsley flakes.
Combine the cheese and liver mixtures and pour into a shallow 1-quart casserole. Bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes or until slightly browned. Remove from the oven and cool.
Prepare Cornmeal Puffs (see recipe on next page).

notes: Serve with Cornmeal Puffs

recipes.title: Cornmeal Puffs

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Bring the water to a boil. Mix the dry ingredients together and add the margarine to the boiling water and stir until melted. Turn the heat to low.
Add the dry ingredients all at once, stirring vigorously. Cook until the mixture draws away from the sides of the pan as you stir.
Remove from heat and cool for 1 minute. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition until the batter is smooth.
Drop the batter by 1/2 teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheets, 1 1/2 inches apart. Sprinkle each lightly with paprika. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden.

Allow the puffs to cool completely. Then gently slice off the top half of each puff, fill with the cooled chile-liver mixture, and replace the top. Refrigerate the puffs from 1 to 5 hours before serving.

notes: Serve with Chicken Livered Cheese 'n Chile Puffs filling

recipes.title: Seviche

instructions.text: Place the scallops in a glass or ceramic bowl and add the remaining ingredients. If you have any concern about the source or freshness of the scallops, they may be poached lightly before marinating.
Refrigerate at least 4 hours, stirring occasionally, before serving.

notes: If concerned about freshness, poach scallops lightly before marinating

ingredients.prep_note: shredded (or any cheese that melts well)

instructions.text: Cook the broccoli according to the package directions. Drain well.
Add the soup, garlic, cheese, and green chiles. Heat until the cheese melts.
Serve warm with corn chips.
Simmer the tomatoes and onions about 20 minutes. Cool the mixture until it is only warm. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir to the desired consistency for a dip.
Serve with tostados.
Mix all the ingredients. Serve with tortilla chips or potato chips.
Combine all ingredients and chill.
Roast, peel, and chop the green chiles. Cut the onion, avocado, and tomato in pieces and put in a blender with the chiles, cheese, cumin, and salt.
Blend at high speed 4 or 5 minutes until well blended.
Serve with corn chips, potato chips, or crackers.
Mix the cream cheese, mayonnaise, cottage cheese, garlic salt, and salt in a blender.
Stir in the chives and green chiles. Serve with potato chips or corn chips.

recipes.title: Traditional Chile con Queso

instructions.text: Saute the onion and garlic in butter until soft. Add the tomato, green chiles, and seasonings and cook over low heat or in the top of a double boiler.
Stir in the cheese and cook until it melts.
Serve with tortilla chips.

notes: Variation: Add 1 1/2 lbs ground beef, browned.

Variation: Omit the tomatoes and add 1 16-oz can tomatoes with green chiles, 8 drops Tabasco sauce, 2 teaspoons flavor enhancer, and 2 tablespoons hot butter. At the last minute add 1/2 can (5 oz) evaporated milk or enough so that the mixture is the right consistency. Serve with corn chips or vegetables.

ingredients.prep_note: seeds and pulp removed and minced

instructions.text: Place all the ingredients in the top of a double boiler. Melt slowly, stirring, until the mixture is smooth. Serve with chips.

recipes.title: Mrs. Mondragon's Cocktail Meatballs

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
Mix the first 6 ingredients together in a large mixing bowl until well blended. Shape the mixture into 1-inch balls. Bake them for 10 minutes.
Saute the mushroom slices in 2 tablespoons butter. Melt 1/4 cup margarine in a saucepan and blend in the flour. Cook a few minutes, stir in the milk, and continue stirring constantly until thickened.
Add the salt, sour cream, mushrooms, green chiles, and pimentos, stirring to blend. Spoon the red chile sauce over the meatballs.

notes: Includes Red Chile Sauce recipe

recipes.title: Chile-Cheese Squares

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Layer the cheese and chiles in a buttered baking dish. Pour the eggs over and dust with the paprika. Bake for 30 minutes or until it tests done.
Cut into small squares and serve as an appetizer.

notes: Variation: Use 1 lb cheddar cheese and 1 lb Monterey Jack cheese. Garnish with black olives and pimentos.

Variation: Use whole green chiles to line a pie pan. Spread 1/2 lb grated cheddar cheese over the chiles. Beat 6 eggs with 2 tablespoons cream and salt and pepper to taste. Pour the mixture over the cheese and chiles and bake as above.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Prepare the hot roll mix following the directions on the box. Break up the bacon, chop the onion, and mix together with the green chiles.
Divide the roll mix into 48 equal parts. Using your hands, spread out each piece and fill it with 1/2 to 3/4 teaspoon of the above mixture.
Pinch the rolls together and bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.

recipes.title: Chile-Izzas

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
Brown the ground beef and drain. Salt to taste.
Separate the biscuits and roll them out into circles. Place them on a greased cookie sheet and spread tomato sauce on them.
Add a layer of meat, then chiles, top with cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Cut each circle into quarters and serve hot.

notes: Variation: Add sour cream or substitute pork sausage for the ground beef.

instructions.text: Wrap the franks in strips of green chile or slice them partially through and fill the openings with green chile sauce.
Wrap tortilla strips around the franks and secure them with toothpicks.
Fry them briefly in hot deep fat until crisp.
Slice the cooked eggs in half and remove the yolks. Mash the yolks with everything except the black olives. Fill the egg whites with the mixture and top each with an olive.
Whisk eggs and water to a froth.
Stir in mint, parsley, green onions, flour, nutmeg, and seasoning.
Continue to mix well while about two inches of oil heats in a large pan.
When the oil is hot enough (about 365° or when a one-inch bread cube browns in sixty seconds) drop egg mixture into the oil by spoonfuls.
Brown about one minute, then turn over and continue to cook until that side has browned.
Keep warm in a 200° oven until ready to serve.

recipes.title: Conch Fritters: Bahamian Style
recipes.source_note: FBC Jasmine Cook Book - printed from Food.com
recipes.description: Traditional Bahamian recipe made with conch, wonderful shellfish from the Bahamas

ingredients.prep_note: or to taste, for dipping sauce

instructions.text: Heat the oil in large pot or deep fryer to 365°F (185°C).
In a bowl, mix the flour, egg and milk.
Season with cayenne pepper, seasoning salt, salt, pepper and red pepper flakes.
Mix in the conch meat, onion, red & yellow & green pepper, celery and garlic.
Drop the batter by rounded tablespoons into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.
BE CAREFUL!
Remove the basket or with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Now, is the time to slightly season, again.
In a bowl, mix the ketchup, 'lime' juice, mayonnaise, hot sauce, salt & pepper.
Serve dipping sauce on the side with the fritters.
Enjoy!

notes: Conch can be replaced with any seafood like calamari, shrimp, imitation crab meat and lobster. BEWARE - these are HOT!

recipes.title: Broccoli Cheddar Rolls

instructions.text: On a lightly floured board, roll thawed dough out to a 12 inch square. Combine remaining ingredients (except margarine) in a small bowl. Spread filling mixture over dough.
Roll up tightly in jelly-roll fashion, pinch along edges to seal. Slice roll into 8 pieces.

Cut each slice in half again not cutting all the way through. Fan out sides to form butterfly shaped rolls. Place on lightly greased cookie sheet, brush with melted margarine, and let rise for 45 minutes.
Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Variation: Add 1 cup diced cooked chicken, turkey, or ham to filling. This recipe can be made ahead of time and frozen.

notes: Can add diced cooked chicken, turkey, or ham
Can be made ahead and frozen

instructions.text: Marinate artichokes overnight in the salad dressing. Drain.
In a shallow baking dish, place artichokes side by side. Fill with the spinach and top with the bread crumbs.
Bake, uncovered, at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

recipes.title: Crab Puffs

instructions.text: Mix together all ingredients, except muffins, adding the crab meat last. Spread on the English muffin halves.
Put in freezer bags after cutting and pop in the oven when unexpected guests arrive. May also serve these whole with soup.
Cook for 10 minutes at 450 degrees.

notes: Can be made ahead and frozen
Great for unexpected guests

recipes.title: Cheese Bowl
recipes.description: A unique cheese ball served in a bread bowl - great for Hostess Gifts!

ingredients.prep_note: crumbled (I really like to use Gorgonzola for this)
(if I can't find a small loaf, I'll use a regular size cut in half, but that does require a double batch of the cheese mixture)

instructions.text: Place all of the ingredients except the beer and the bread in a large bowl. Let this mixture stand at least 30 minutes at room temperature to soften.
Then, either with a wooden spoon or more easily with an electric mixer, blend in the beer, adding it slowly.
Keep beating until the mixture is smooth, light and fluffy. To make the 'bowl', cut a slice from the top of the loaf of bread and scoop out the center, leaving a 'bowl' of the sides and bottom.
Fill the loaf bowl with the cheese mixture, rounding it on top. Cover with a kitchen wrap and refrigerate until time to serve with crackers.
This can be frozen. We're always searching for unique, but simple ideas for 'Hostess Gifts', well here is one that has both attributes.

notes: Can be frozen
Great as a hostess gift

recipes.title: Crabbies

instructions.text: Combine ingredients together and spread on English muffins. Cut into quarters.
Freeze, then package and store.
TO SERVE: Remove from freezer (do not thaw) and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

notes: Make ahead and freeze for convenience

instructions.text: Mix together well, shape into a ball. Cover with cream cheese.
May be thinned with mayonnaise.
Even if you don't like spinach, you'll love these!

recipes.title: Spinach Balls

instructions.text: Cook spinach as directed on package; drain well.
In large bowl, mix together all ingredients. Form into balls and freeze.
Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly brown.

notes: Can be made ahead and frozen

instructions.text: Peel avocados. Mash with a fork in a medium bowl.
Stir in tomato, onion, lime or lemon juice, garlic powder and salt. Serve at once.
Makes 6 servings.
Mix well and roll in 3 sticks about size of half dollar in diameter. Wrap in foil and refrigerate for 24 hours.
Place in shallow pan and bake 1 hour at 300 degrees. If you make larger rolls, bake longer.
Mix all ingredients together.
Heat and serve warm with crackers or bread.

recipes.title: Ham & Cream Cheese Roll Ups
recipes.attribution: F.B.C. of Jasmine Lakes Cookbook - Kathy Ayers

ingredients.item: pkgs of medium sliced Honey Ham Lunch Meat
ingredients.prep_note: not the fat free! Amount depends on number desired to make

ingredients.item: jar of black small pitted olives

instructions.text: Lay one slice of ham on cutting board, spread a layer of cream cheese on ham, roll then slice into small pieces.
Use toothpicks to hold olives on top and to hold roll together.

notes: "Jesus had the headache to top all headaches, all thorns and no Tylenol"

instructions.text: Mix everything except pecans.
Chill several hours or overnight.
Spread chopped pecans on wax paper and roll the cheese ball on it until coated.
Chill completely before serving.

ingredients.prep_note: OR egg roll sheets cut in quarters

instructions.text: Mix filling ingredients together.
Place about one teaspoon of filling in center of wonton skin and fold over making a triangle, sealing edges by wetting with water.
Deep fry in hot oil until golden and meat is cooked (about five minutes).
Serve with catsup mixed with Coleman dry mustard or with sweet and sour sauce.
Cream together cream cheese, olives, chilies, Tabasco sauce.
Spread approximately 2 tablespoons onto a tortilla and roll jelly-roll fashion.
Roll in plastic wrap and chill.
Before serving cut into 3/8 inch wide pieces and serve with salsa for dipping.

recipes.title: Crab Canapes

instructions.text: Mix above ingredients together and spread on English muffin halves.
Cut each muffin into quarters.
Freeze, then package and store.
TO SERVE: Remove from freezer (do not thaw) and bake at 350°F for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

notes: Great make-ahead appetizer for unexpected guests

instructions.text: Press carrots between paper towels to remove excess moisture; set aside.
Combine Neufchatel cheese and cheddar cheese in a medium bowl; stir well.
Add carrots and garlic; stir well. Cover and chill 1 hour. These ingredients may also be combined in a food processor and mixed.
Shape cheese mixture into a ball; roll in parsley.
Wrap in wax paper and chill at least 1 hour.

recipes.title: Aunt Maude's Cheese Ball

instructions.text: Mix cheese and butter.
Add flour, salt, paprika and cayenne pepper.
Roll into 1 inch balls.
Poke hole with your finger and put in some filling (green olives, sausage meat, or pecans).
Close hole and bake at 400°F for 20 minutes.

notes: Filling options: green olives, sausage meat, or pecans

instructions.text: Mix together salmon with cream cheese, lemon juice, horseradish, and onion.
Refrigerate until firm.
Mix parsley and pecans together.
Form salmon mixture into ball and roll in pecan-parsley mixture.
Serve with crackers.

recipes.title: Olive Cheese Ball

instructions.text: In medium bowl, combine softened cream cheese with both types of olives, onions and Tabasco sauce, mix thoroughly.
Set cheese mixture in refrigerator about 15 minutes to harden slightly for easier handling.
Shape cheese mixture into ball. Roll in chopped parsley to coat well.
Return to refrigerator, chill 15 to 20 minutes or until serving.
Serve with assorted crackers.

notes: If made a day ahead, wrap loosely in wax paper
Leftovers can be used as a sandwich spread on rye bread for lunch

instructions.text: Cook livers, covered in small amount of butter, stirring occasionally until no longer pink.
Put livers through meat grinder, blend with remaining ingredients.
Place in 2 cup mold.
Chill several hours.
Garnish with chopped chives or hard-cooked eggs.
Serve with crackers.

ingredients.prep_note: thawed, OR 24-36 unbaked mini pastry shells

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In large bowl, beat eggs, soup mix, broccoli and cottage cheese until well blended.
Refrigerate 20 minutes.
Prepare pastry shell on 13x11 cookie sheet or use mini pastry shells.
Spoon broccoli mixture into baking dish or shells, using 1 tablespoon broccoli mixture per shell.
Bake for 40 minutes or until center is set.
Cool 15 minutes before cutting into squares or removing from baking pan.

recipes.title: Conch Fritters: Bahamian Style
recipes.description: A traditional Bahamian recipe that is made with conch, the wonderful shellfish. These fritters are great as appetizers, finger foods or very tasty hors d'oeuvres.

instructions.text: Mix flour, milk, egg and seasonings to make a batter.
Fold in conch, onion, peppers, celery and garlic.
Heat oil to 350°F.
Drop batter by spoonfuls into hot oil.
Fry until golden brown, turning once.
Drain on paper towels.

notes: Conch can be replaced with calamari, shrimp, imitation crab meat and lobster
BEWARE - these are HOT!

recipes.title: Benedictine Sandwich
recipes.description: A Kentucky classic cucumber and cream cheese spread for sandwiches or finger food.

instructions.text: Grate cucumbers and drain well. Grate onion.
Blend these into cream cheese and add enough mayo to make a soft spread.
Season lightly and add drops of coloring to make a delicate green.
Makes 1 1/2 cups. Don't use a blender - too runny.
Makes great finger sandwiches! Also makes a great stuffing for tomatoes or mushrooms.

notes: Kentucky classic sandwich spread
Don't use a blender - makes it too runny

recipes.title: Egg Salad Turnovers
recipes.description: Savory egg salad baked in flaky biscuit turnovers.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F (205°C). In medium bowl, combine eggs, green pepper, mayonnaise, mustard, dill seed and salt.
Separate dough into 5 biscuits. Place on ungreased cookie sheet; press each to 5 inch circle.
Spoon about 2 tablespoons egg mixture onto center of each biscuit; sprinkle with cheese.
Fold dough in half over egg mixture, press edges with fingers to seal.
Brush turnovers with egg white, sprinkle with sesame seed, if desired.
Bake at 400°F for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Refrigerate leftovers. 2 to 4 servings.
TIP: To reheat wrap loosely in foil, heat at 375°F for 12 to 15 minutes.
